title: Harry Styles' stalker spared jail and given restraining order
text:
Harry Styles’ stalker has been spared jail (Picture: SWNS)

Harry Styles’ stalker was spared jail today, but was issued with a restraining order to stay away from the star.

Pablo Tarazaga-Orero, 26, had been found guilty of stalking Styles, 25, over a period of two months.

However, today, Judge Nigel Dean sentenced Tarazaga-Orero to a 12 month community order requiring 30 days of rehabilitation activity and ordered him to pay £335 in total including £250 costs.

The judge told the Spanish national, who is homeless in London: ‘Firstly I am making a restraining order in any case it’s going to be for an indefinite period and will include the following prohibit you from entering the following area highlighted in red.

‘It centres on the home address of Harry Styles and some of the adjacent lanes to keep you well away from his address.

Pablo Tarazaga-Orero was found guilty of stalking (Picture: SWNS)

‘You’re not to contact directly or indirectly Harry Styles including posting any messages on any social media platforms.’

The order also forbids Tarazaga-Orero from going within 250 metres of Harry, any of his business or residential addresses, and any venue where he is performing.

Styles’ ordeal began on 10 March when he offered Tarazaga-Orero money to stay in a hotel after seeing him sleeping rough at a bus stop near his home in Hampstead.

The Sign Of The Times singer told Hendon Magistrates’ Court (from behind a screen): ‘I thought it was sad that someone so young, that anyone was sleeping rough at the bus stop when it was cold.

‘I felt sorry for him.

‘That evening I pulled up in my car next to the bus stop and I offered him some money so that he could get a hotel or some food.’

Harry told the court that he felt unsafe in his home (Picture: Helene Marie Pambrun via Getty Images)

Tarazago-Orero reportedly asked Styles to buy him edamame beans, with the singer getting a bag of wraps and muffins from a nearby vegan cafe.

Styles continued: ‘I passed him the bag of food through the window, at which point he asked me whether I wanted to go to a restaurant to eat with him.

‘I found it to be a little odd. Something about it, his facial expression made me feel uneasy and it was at this point I realised there was something not quite straightforward about this situation.’

Styles was advised by his security team not to interact with him, but Tarazeg-Orera began to appear outside his home and in Harry’s local pub, and was twice seen putting items into his letterbox.

Advertisement

The singer said: ‘I felt sorry for him but at this point I felt very uncomfortable. It was the first time since living there I felt unsafe in my home.’

Tarazaga-Orero has been homeless since February (Picture: Paul Davey/SWNS)

Things stepped up a notch when Tarazag-Orera tried to grab Styles while he wad out jogging, and demanded the money Styles had initially offered.

The former One Direction star said: ‘I have employed a night guard, which I never felt necessary before. I continue to lock my bedroom door at night.

‘I find myself assessing my residence looking for any weak spots in it. I worry about it much more, I never felt that way before.’

When asked how he felt about Tarazaga-Orero, the star said: ‘I would like him to get some help.

‘I would also prefer to have no contact going forward with him, directly or indirectly. I would like to feel safe again.’

Tarazago-Orera has been in the UK for four and a half years and became homeless in February.

In court, he alleged that Styles had approached him as he slept at a bus stop and invited him to ‘have some fun’ at a hotel.

Judge Nigel Dean said: ‘Mr Styles felt sorry for a young man he saw to be living outside a home in the winter when it was raining heavily.

Advertisement

‘Having first noticed him, he would, out of the goodness of his heard, step on the 10 March and offered to pay a hotel for the evening.

‘I find the suggestion that Mr Styles was suggesting he accompany him to be completely incredible.’
